@hannahb_crafts adding the bellybutton use a tapestry needle and dark grey yarn the bellybutton is made using a french knot the instructions below will help if you haven t done one before insert your needle at reinsert your needle the back or side of the one stitch higher but body somewhere and do not pull through bring it out where you have it about halfway want the bellybutton to through as shown in be i put mine in the the image centre of the belly at about row 12 or 13 wrap the yarn around the reinsert your needle in needle tip about 5 or 6 one of the stitches of times but not too tightly pinch the yarn that s the bellybutton and wrapped around the bring it out at the same needle and also hold the stitch where you end of yarn that s hanging originally inserted tie it out from where you together and weave in originally inserted it and ends pull the needle through the yarn wrapped around it adding the fur use 2mm hook and ginger eyelash yarn use pins to mark where you want the fur to go mark out the edges of the face and belly i placed the face pins about 3 stitches away from the ears at the sides and at about row 6 at the top the body pins are placed about 1 stitch away from the arms then the belly area becomes about 15 stitches wide when it s near the bellybutton and ends at row 7 of the body at the bottom of the belly © 2021 hb crafts all rights reserved this pattern is for personal use only 19 hannah bickerstaff - @hannahb_crafts start surface crocheting in the magic_ring at the base of the body continue in spirals but don t worry if it s not perfect as the fur covers any mistakes if you ve never surface crocheted before make sure to take your time and try not to let your hook come off the yarn as it can be tricky to find again here s a video tutorial showing how to surface
